member.name: T:AgCubio.Cube
member.summary:
A cube contains: * A unique id * The position in space(x, y) * A color * A name -- if this is a player cube * A mass * Food status (is this cube food or a player)
These should be derived properties based on mass: * Width, Top, Left, Right, Bottom

member.name: P:AgCubio.Cube.loc_x
member.summary: x coordinate of the center of the cube

member.name: P:AgCubio.Cube.loc_y
member.summary: y coordinate of the center of the cube

member.name: P:AgCubio.Cube.argb_color
member.summary: integer representation of the ARGB color value

member.name: P:AgCubio.Cube.Name
member.summary: The name on the cube - if food, the name will be an empty string

member.name: P:AgCubio.Cube.Mass
member.summary: mass of the cube - if set attempts a value less than 1, we'll default to 1

member.name: P:AgCubio.Cube.Width
member.summary: Width is the square root of the mass. We will drop all decimal values. Width is a read only property

member.name: P:AgCubio.Cube.Radius
member.summary: Radius is half the square root of the mass. We will drop all decimal values. Radius is a read only property

member.name: M:AgCubio.Cube.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Default contructor of the cube object

member.name: T:AgCubio.World
member.summary: Represents 'State' of world. Responsible for tracking: * the world Width and Height (read only 'constants') * all the cubes in the game.
